page.title: 09CROFTING
page.content: VERY FEW CROFTERS IN BURRA ARE FULL TIME, MOST HAVING ANOTHER JOB LIKE WORKING FOR THE COUNCIL, TAXI HIRE OR FOR THE WOMEN, KNITTING. MOST LIKE THE LAMBING TIME BEST AND THE WEATHER WHEN IT'S FINE. MOST WANTED TO BE NOTHING ELSE BUT A CROFTER. USUALLY THEY GET UP IN THE MORNING BETWEEN 6.30 AND 8.00 A.M. MOST CROFTERS NOW HAVE A LOT OF MACHINES TO WORK WITH AND IT IS A PROBLEM IF THEY BREAK DOWN. ANIMALS ARE MOSTLY SHEEP, THOUGH THERE ARE ONE OR TWO COWS AND THERE ARE SOMETIMES GOATS. THE BUSIEST TIME IS SPRING WHEN THEY HAVE TO GET UP IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT FOR LAMBING. MOST CROFTERS EAT WHAT THEY PRODUCE LIKE POTATOES, VEGETABLES AND OCCASIONALLY BUTTER OR MILK. SOME SELL THEIR OWN LAMBS AND BUY MEAT FROM THE BUTCHER INSTEAD OF EATING THEIR OWN.
